name: Brown Sugar Garlic Butter Pork Roast
description: Recipe video above. Ultra tender pork with an insane caramelised crust and a buttery sweet-savoury sauce. The pairing of the sweet with the savoury is incredible in this pork roast!
recipeIngredient: 1.75 - 2kg / 3.5 - 4lb   pork shoulder / butt (, cut into 8 equal pieces (Note 1))
1/4 cup / 65 ml   cider vinegar ((white wine or red wine vinegar also fine))

recipeInstructions.text: Place Sauce ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Once better has melted, stir to combine then leave for 1 - 2 minutes until sugar is melted. Remove from heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Place Sauce ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Once better has melted, stir to combine then leave for 1 - 2 minutes until sugar is melted. Remove from heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle pork pieces all over with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle pork pieces all over with salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Line pan with foil then parchment / baking paper, place pork in pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Line pan with foil then parchment / baking paper, place pork in pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour Sauce all over pork. Cover with foil. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour Sauce all over pork. Cover with foil. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oven, remove foil. Turn pork. Return to oven uncovered for 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from oven, remove foil. Turn pork. Return to oven uncovered for 20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oven. Turn pork, spoon pan juices over. Return to oven for 20 - 30 minutes or until pork is golden and sauce has reduced to a thin syrup (thickens more when it cools).
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from oven. Turn pork, spoon pan juices over. Return to oven for 20 - 30 minutes or until pork is golden and sauce has reduced to a thin syrup (thickens more when it cools).

recipeInstructions.text: Stand for 5 minutes, then turn pork to coat in sauce. Serve pork with syrupy pan sauce. Pictured in post with this Everyday Cabbage Salad.
recipeInstructions.name: Stand for 5 minutes, then turn pork to coat in sauce. Serve pork with syrupy pan sauce. Pictured in post with this Everyday Cabbage Salad.

review.reviewBody: Winner winner chicken dinner, Oops Pork Dinner. We are pork wholesalers my other half has lived Pork from childhood, he was very impressed so thank you thank you for allowing to impress him ðŸ¤£
The recipe is good, but it never darkened or thickened.  Too much fat and water came out of the pork.  Made tacos with the left overs, topped with the slaw.  Delicious.
I make this very frequently now.  The only difference is that I add a splash of soy sauce. So good!
Not sue what I did wrong. This was my first RTI â€˜failureâ€™. Followed the recipe exactly and ended up with tough pork in a watery sauce.

Very tasty even though we only just threw the shredded meat on buns/barm cakes or what ever they are called, too many names over soft rounded bread :) very filling and our 9 year old daughter missed out big time, been out trick or treating and stuffed out of her face with sweets, well, more for the rest of us :) Thank you and happy Halloween x

Hi Nagy - delicious recipe! Pork was tender and we served it with the no mayo coleslaw. One thing - I used a scotch fillet and the sauce didnâ€™t really thicken. A lot of moisture came out of the meat so we had to decant it into a saucepan and thicken it on the hob with some cornflour.
Sorry I wasnâ€™t meant to click the stars for the review!

Hi Nagi, I wanted to make this and ordered a pork slow cook scotch roast from coles, but they substituted it for a â€˜pork mini leg roast bonelessâ€™ which is approx 1.1kg. Could I use that for this recipe

Making this for the first time, and my entire house smells AMAZING!!! My husband even came out of his office (works from home and usually glued to his seat) just to see what I was cooking! Making a double recipe to feed our three growing boys, and I know they are going to LOVE it! This is my first time using a recipe of yours and I'm adding the everyday cabbage salad as suggested. Can't wait! Thank you Nagi!!!
